20110131220101.000|20110131220104.000|TR0|week into a grassroots uprising demanding 
20110131220104.000|20110131220106.000|TR0|an end to 30 years of authoritarian rule 
20110131220106.000|20110131220109.000|TR0|by the president, Hosni Mubarak.  We're 
20110131220109.000|20110131220112.000|TR0|following all of the latest developments, 
20110131220112.000|20110131220114.000|TR0|as thousands and thousands of people 
20110131220114.000|20110131220117.000|TR0|continue to defy the curfew.  A team of 
20110131220117.000|20110131220119.000|TR0|heavily armed U.S. Marines has been sent 
20110131220119.000|20110131220122.000|TR0|to the U.S. Embassy in Cairo to provide 
20110131220122.000|20110131220125.000|TR0|additional security.  More than 500 
20110131220125.000|20110131220127.000|TR0|Americans already have been evacuated from 
20110131220127.000|20110131220130.000|TR0|Egypt aboard five flights, with many more 
20110131220130.000|20110131220133.000|TR0|planned.  And protesters now say they're 
20110131220133.000|20110131220135.000|TR0|organizing what they call a million man 
20110131220135.000|20110131220138.000|TR0|march through Cairo and Alexandria 
20110131220138.000|20110131220140.000|TR0|tomorrow.

20110131221153.000|20110131221156.000|TR0|FREDERIK PLEITGEN, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  
20110131221156.000|20110131221158.000|TR0|Well, it's -- it's a little bit of a 
20110131221158.000|20110131221201.000|TR0|shift, Wolf.  We are seeing some traffic 
20110131221201.000|20110131221203.000|TR0|cops on the beat that we haven't seen over 
20110131221203.000|20110131221206.000|TR0|the past couple of days.  In fact, I 
20110131221206.000|20110131221209.000|TR0|actually walked past the makeshift 
20110131221209.000|20110131221211.000|TR0|checkpoints here, just a couple of yards 
20110131221211.000|20110131221214.000|TR0|from where we are right here, a couple of 
20110131221214.000|20110131221216.000|TR0|minutes ago.  And there were actually a 
20110131221216.000|20110131221219.000|TR0|couple of traffic police who were trying 
20110131221219.000|20110131221222.000|TR0|to keep the peace and man that checkpoint, 
20110131221222.000|20110131221224.000|TR0|together with some of these people who 
20110131221224.000|20110131221227.000|TR0|have been arming themselves and trying to

20110131221229.000|20110131221232.000|TR0|was sort of a makeshift checkpoint that 
20110131221232.000|20110131221235.000|TR0|was going on.  And they were stopping cars 
20110131221235.000|20110131221237.000|TR0|together.
20110131221237.000|20110131221240.000|TR0|

20110131221243.000|20110131221245.000|TR0|sort of one form of police that a lot of

20110131221248.000|20110131221250.000|TR0|However, in large parts of the city, there

20110131221845.000|20110131221848.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  First 
20110131221848.000|20110131221850.000|TR0|came Iran, then Tunisia, now Egypt.  And 
20110131221850.000|20110131221853.000|TR0|as popular uprisings sweep through the 
20110131221853.000|20110131221855.000|TR0|Middle East, it is hard to underestimate 
20110131221855.000|20110131221858.000|TR0|the role that's being played by social 
20110131221858.000|20110131221901.000|TR0|media and new technologies, Twitter, 
20110131221901.000|20110131221903.000|TR0|Facebook, YouTube, cell phones, even cable 
20110131221903.000|20110131221906.000|TR0|news outlets, are putting a tremendous 
20110131221906.000|20110131221908.000|TR0|amount of power into the hands of ordinary 
20110131221908.000|20110131221911.000|TR0|people, and don't think for a minute that 
20110131221911.000|20110131221914.000|TR0|the rest of the Arab world isn't watching 
20110131221914.000|20110131221916.000|TR0|closely.  For starters, these 
20110131221916.000|20110131221919.000|TR0|communications tools allow ordinary 
20110131221919.000|20110131221921.000|TR0|citizens to plan and organize protests in 
20110131221921.000|20110131221924.000|TR0|a way that was unthinkable just a few 
20110131221924.000|20110131221927.000|TR0|short years ago.
20110131221927.000|20110131221929.000|TR0|
20110131221929.000|20110131221932.000|TR0|They can spread the word about mass 
20110131221932.000|20110131221934.000|TR0|demonstrations, ensuring that more people 
20110131221934.000|20110131221937.000|TR0|will show up and in turn the sheer size of 
20110131221937.000|20110131221940.000|TR0|some of these protests makes it impossible 
20110131221940.000|20110131221942.000|TR0|or close to impossible for the government 
20110131221942.000|20110131221945.000|TR0|to crack down and stop them.  Also, thanks 
20110131221945.000|20110131221947.000|TR0|to Facebook and Twitter, the protests 
20110131221947.000|20110131221950.000|TR0|aren't happening in a vacuum like they may 
20110131221950.000|20110131221953.000|TR0|have decades ago.  When young Egyptians 
20110131221953.000|20110131221955.000|TR0|take to the streets by the thousands, the 
20110131221955.000|20110131221958.000|TR0|world is seeing it and hearing about it in 
20110131221958.000|20110131222000.000|TR0|real time, through texts and tweets and 
20110131222000.000|20110131222003.000|TR0|pictures and videos.

20110131222347.000|20110131222350.000|TR0|marches are all about.  That is the
